snippet: The John W. Engeman Theater at Northport presents yet another version of “A Christmas Carol,” which has proved among the most enduring and endearing of holiday entertainments.
abstract: Aileen Jacobson reviews Michael Wilson stage adaptation of Charles Dickens's A Christmas Carol, directed by Mark Adam Rampmeyer and starring Wilbur Edwin Henry, at the John W Engeman Theater (Metropolitan/Long Island).
lead_paragraph: The John W. Engeman Theater at Northport presents yet another version of “A Christmas Carol,” which has proved among the most enduring and endearing of holiday entertainments.

headline.print_headline: Vexed by Yuletide Spirits, and Vowing to Change
headline.seo: A Review of ‘A Christmas Carol,’ in Northport
headline.main: Vexed by Yuletide Spirits, and Vowing to Change
